title: Amusement Parks in Taiwan
intro: Discover the most thrilling rides, family-friendly theme parks, and cultural resorts across Taiwan.

spots.name: Taipei Children's Amusement Park (臺北市立兒童新樂園)
spots.description: An affordable, family-friendly park operated by the Taipei Metro. Features 13 major rides and an indoor play area, perfect for younger children.

spots.name: Yehliu Ocean World (野柳海洋世界)
spots.description: Located beside the famous Geopark, featuring marine life exhibits and high-diving performances. A core attraction of the North Coast.

spots.name: Yun Hsien Resort (雲仙樂園)
spots.description: The only park in Taiwan accessible solely by cable car. A secluded spot in Wulai famous for Atayal culture, ferns, and fireflies.

spots.name: Window on World Theme Park (小人國主題樂園)
spots.description: Famous for its exquisite miniature models of world landmarks. The park also features indoor/outdoor rides and a water park.

spots.name: Leofoo Village Theme Park (六福村主題遊樂園)
spots.description: Known as the 'Disney of Taiwan', combining a safari zoo with a mechanical theme park. Features the iconic 'Screaming Condor' ride.

spots.name: Little Ding-Dong Science Theme Park (小叮噹科學主題樂園)
spots.description: An educational park focusing on scientific principles like optics and acoustics. Also houses Taiwan's largest indoor ski resort.

spots.name: Wan Ruey Forest Park (萬瑞森林樂園)
spots.description: Situated in Hengshan Township, this forest park offers cabin accommodation, camping, and mountain training facilities surrounded by natural beauty.

spots.name: West Lake Resortopia (西湖渡假村)
spots.description: A European-style resort famous for its Andersen fairy tale themes and the stunning Tung Blossom season.

spots.name: Shangrila Paradise (香格里拉樂園)
spots.description: Combines Hakka culture with vintage amusement rides. It is also home to 'CMP Village', a popular glamping and cultural aesthetics site.

spots.name: Lihpao Land (麗寶樂園)
spots.description: Central Taiwan's largest resort with land/water parks, an outlet mall, a racing circuit, and the 'Sky Dream' Ferris wheel.

spots.name: Dongshih Forest Garden (東勢林場遊樂區)
spots.description: Known as the 'Yangmingshan of Central Taiwan'. A prime spot for eco-tourism, firefly watching, and forest bathing.

spots.name: Formosan Aboriginal Culture Village (九族文化村)
spots.description: Preserves the heritage of Taiwan's indigenous tribes. Features cultural shows, rides, and a cable car connection to Sun Moon Lake.

spots.name: Atayal Resort (泰雅渡假村)
spots.description: Located in Guoxing Township, offering high-altitude skywalks, hot springs, and immersive Atayal indigenous culture experiences.

spots.name: Sun-Link-Sea Forest Resort (杉林溪森林生態渡假園區)
spots.description: A high-altitude forest park famous for its waterfalls, hydrangeas, and peony flower seasons. Great for hiking.

spots.name: Janfusun Fancyworld (劍湖山世界)
spots.description: A major landmark in Southern Taiwan featuring the G5 Diving Machine coaster and massive New Year's Eve fireworks.

spots.name: Wanpi World Safari Zoo (頑皮世界野生動物園)
spots.description: Southern Taiwan's largest semi-open zoo. Emphasizes close interaction with animals like capybaras and giraffes.

spots.name: Liuying Jianshanpi Resort (柳營尖山埤渡假村)
spots.description: A scenic lakeside resort managed by Taiwan Sugar Corp. Offers paintball, canoeing, lake cruises, and wooden cabin stays.

spots.name: E-DA Theme Park (義大遊樂世界)
spots.description: A Greek-themed park part of a massive resort complex with an outlet mall and hotels. Offers a romantic vacation vibe.

spots.name: Suzuka Circuit Park (鈴鹿賽道樂園)
spots.description: The only driving-themed park in Taiwan, authorized by Japan's Suzuka Circuit. Features a professional go-kart track.

spots.name: Xiao Kenting Resort (小墾丁渡假村)
spots.description: A log cabin resort located in Manzhou Township. Famous for its starry skies and ecological tours, offering a peaceful escape from the beach crowds.

spots.name: Dancewoods Japanese Theme Park (綠舞日式主題園區)
spots.description: Taiwan's first Japanese garden-themed park. Offers Yukata experiences, matcha tea ceremonies, and interactions with cute animals like capybaras.

spots.name: Farglory Ocean Park (遠雄海洋公園)
spots.description: Taiwan's only international marine theme park. Built along the coast, offering dolphin shows and stunning Pacific Ocean views.

spots.name: Yiyuan Resort (怡園渡假村)
spots.description: An eco-friendly resort known as a 'Home for Old Trees', featuring over 3,000 transplanted trees, pools, and slides for family fun.
